page.title: 16Places of Worship.
page.content: Churches and Chapels play an important role in our area and there is a variety to choose from.Both Barlestone and Mkt. Bosworth boast a parish church- St. Giles' and St. Peter's. St. Peter's is built upon the site of a Saxon Church, but most of the building was constructe in the 14th. and 15th. centuries, when the roof was raised and the clerestory added and the spire built. There is an interesting squint in the south aisle, through which the choir can be observed. Like st. Peter's, st.Gile's church is involved in the community with a Sunday School and a fellowship group. Both schools are linked with the primary schools. There is a Methodist Chapel and a Catholic Church in Barlestone,with a Free Church and a Catholic Church in Bosworth.
